text: V. K. Murthy (; 26 November 1923 - 7 April 2014) was an Indian cinematographer. During his career, he won two Filmfare Awards in the best cinematographer category. His best known movies are Pyaasa (1957), Kaagaz Ke Phool (1959) and Sahib Bibi Aur Ghulam (1962). For each of those movies, he won a Filmfare Award. He was born in Mysore, Kingdom of Mysore and lived in Mumbai for most of his life. Murthy died on 7 April 2014 at his home in Bangalore, India. He was 90 years old. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1923 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Cinematographers Category:Disease-related deaths in India Category:People from Mumbai
title: V. K. Murthy
